item.title: alana add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "It is perhaps the misfortune of my life that I am interested in far too much but not decisively in any one thing; all my interests are not subordinated in one but stand on an equal footing." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: alana add a quote by Marisa Meltzer
item.description: "But wouldn't [the Spice Girls] have shown a little bit more solidarity if they had at least called themselves feminists? The feminist activist Jennifer Pozner was more dismissive,writing that it was "probably a fair assumption to say that 'zigazig-ha' is not Spice shorthand for 'subvert the dominant paradigm." -- Marisa Meltzer

item.title: alana add a quote by Rainbow Rowell
item.description: "To really be a nerd, she'd decided, you had to prefer fictional worlds to the real one." -- Rainbow Rowell

item.title: alana add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I thought about adults. I wondered if that was true: if they were all really children wrapped in adult bodies, like childrenâ€™s books hidden in the middle of dull, long adult books, the kind with no pictures or conversations." -- Neil Gaiman
